oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Word and Music Night - 2010-04-27
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Words and Music Night program held in the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on April 27, 2010. Professional songwriters with student co-writers performing songs they have written together during the course of the school year. Hosted by Kent Blazy and Cory Batten.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kent Blazy; Cory Batten;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: "Performances include; You Can Be My One Love (Lee Young with Cale Alexander, Angie Celada-Gonzales, Jahzeel Gayle, & Chrissy Wood); I Love You, Mama (Bob Spanburgh with Montana McMillan); I’ll Bet I’ve Got More (Gary Culley with Jesse Boone); Just Another Taylor Swift Song (John Feld with Jane Bowman-Trently); Ocean Blue (Tammy Vise with Tommy Akers, Hunter Champion, Brandon Rackley, & Tanner Reese); Butterflies (Tim Buppert with Sarah Cullum and Meg Smith); Poor Little Cucumbers (Bill Maier with Olivia Montoya); The Unity Song (Candace Corrigan & Janne Henshaw with Asiyah Nesmith); My Dog (Sandy Ramos with Caroline Cline, Samantha Lance, Miller McCallister, & Avery Taylor); Ping Pong (Steven Farmer with Noah Ashley & Max Poore); Walking on the Streets of Gold (Misty Rae with Brenley Baker); You Don’t Get to Be Seventeen Again (Jeff Dayton with Clint Sanderson); Country Ride (Leanne Miele with Ryan Smith); Joe Had a Hole in His Pocket (Kim Copeland with John Edward Griffin & Joe McMahan); Toast (Joel Atkins with Desmond Crowder); Unidentified song likely titled We Always Played For The Girls (Kent Blazy and Cory Batten).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Blazy, Kent; Batten, Cory; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
